result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Michael Mahkimetas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Emergency 9-1-1 call, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 256.35(10)(a).
  • False Emergency 9-1-1 call, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 256.35(10)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence withheld and deft. placed on 2 years DOC probation.

miscConds.notes: Court costs of $463 payable at the rate of $100/mo beginning 7-15-22 paid to Clerk of Courts.  In default of payment, State Debt Collections.  Supervision fees to be paid to DOC during probation.  DNA sample ordered.
Follow through with all recommendations and appointments.  Take all medications as prescribed.

Absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages. Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Not to abuse 911 Emergency Call System.

timeConds.notes: 23 days jail - time served.  Credit for 23 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Prosecuting attorney John Luetscher in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Recommendations by DOC reviewed.  State makes recommendation.  Defense makes recommendation.  Deft makes statement.  Court orders time served 35 days credit each count concurrent. Deft. to be released today.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: 10:28Defendant Richard Michael Mahkimetas in court, in custody.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Richard Michael Mahkimetas. Complaint reviewed.  Plea and waiver questionnaire reviewed.  Guilty plea entered on both counts.  Plea made freely and voluntarily.  Court finds deft. guilty and orders JOC entered into the record.  State makes recommendations.  Atty Spansail makes recommendation.  Deft. makes statement.  Sentence withheld and deft. placed on DOC Probation for 2 years.  Conditions of Probation include court costs of $463 each count for a total of $926 payable at the rate of $100/mo to COC beginning 7-15-22.  In default of payment, State Debt Collections.  Supervision fees to be paid to DOC during probation.  DNA sample ordered.  23 days jail - time served; Psychological evaluation and follow through; Take all medications as prescribed; No possession/consumption of alcohol, illegal drugs, or controlled substance without a valid prescription; Not to abuse 911 Emergency system.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
